history.text: Have you seen Catch Me If You Can, with Leonardo Dicaprio?

Yes several times. What do you think about Christopher W
alkens roll
Walken's role as Leo's father seemed very supportive.
He was. I liked that this was based on real events, Its wild how it all happened.
Only back in those days could that have happened.
True. Its kind of a cinderella story of sorts. First leos character ended up in Jail then was asked by FBI to help with their cases.
Check fraud being his major crime, and the reason why we have so many laws and restrictions in place now.

Yes, which i
s very good from the movie its seemed too easy. But its probably because the way they filmed it.
More or less, it never took the story overtly serious.

Right, in a way its good because it keeps the interest of many different audiences. I am glad that security is so much better now because the way he was able to get away with being a doctor was scary, glad its not that easy now.
What do you think about Frank Jr. mom?
It's been so long since I've seen the movie, it's hard to remember her.
She was french but because the family fell on hard times she started an affair with one of Frank Sr. friends.
Wow, I vaguely remember that. Doesn't seem to classy.
Nope and she left him.
I should hope so, if he hadn't already left her.
How do you think he managed to fake being a pilot once he got to the cockpit? Did he ever learn to really fly?
From what i can remember i believe he was a very smart kid and he read up about it. But even in doing that, i cant remember if he was the actual pilot or just the co-pilot.
Insane that he banked over two million dollars from Pan Am alone, in fraudulent checks.
Yes. The sad part about the whole ordeal is that because he was running from the FBI he was not around when his father passed away.
He was told about it after he was out of prison. After he found that out he tried escaping again, only to find that his mom was living in his child hood home with the guy she cheated with.
What do you think about Frank being visited by Carl visits him while he in Jail?
I have to say that through the entire movie I was rooting for the "bad guy" the movie in my opinion was great.
What do you think about the rating of the movie?
